HDG.LOG.content: every gathering a laying, every laying is of itself a gathering > to let lie (liegen lassen), legein as letting-lie-together (beisammen-vor-liegen-Lassen) concerns us [why us?], concerned w/ retaining (behalten) [holding], protection (Hut)
HDG.LOG.linkedContent: every gathering a laying, every laying is of itself a gathering > to let lie (liegen lassen), legein as letting-lie-together (beisammen-vor-liegen-Lassen) concerns us [why us?], concerned w/ retaining (behalten) [holding], protection (Hut)

HDG.LOG.content: a protection in which what lies before remains (bleibt) laid down: stored, laid away, secured & deposited in unconcealment (Unverborgenheit), sheltered in unconcealment > the keisthai of upokeimenon: presencing (Anwesen) of that which lies before us into unconcealment: legein concerns safety (Geborgenheit), safekeeping, gathering appropriate to such a laying [what about annihilation?], safety of that which comes together into presence (des beisammen-Anwesenden)

motif.name: UNSCATHED / SAFE / SACRED / GUARD / SECURITY / KEEP
motif.title: UNSCATHED / SAFE / SACRED / GUARD / SECURITY / KEEP

motif.title: PREORGINARY SYNTHESIS [Derrida bringing together instead of dividing?]

HDG.LOG.linkedContent: a protection in which what lies before remains (bleibt) laid down: stored, laid away, secured & deposited in unconcealment (Unverborgenheit), sheltered in unconcealment > the keisthai of upokeimenon: presencing (Anwesen) of that which lies before us into unconcealment: legein concerns safety (Geborgenheit), safekeeping, gathering appropriate to such a laying [what about annihilation?], safety of that which comes together into presence (des beisammen-Anwesenden)

HDG.LOG.content: “we are all ears when our gathering devotes itself entirely to hearkening” > “we have heard (gehört) when we belong to (gehören) the matter addressed (Zugesprochenen)”: letting that which lies before lie gathered in its entirety [wholeness], selfsameness, omologein, the letting-lie establishes
HDG.LOG.linkedContent: “we are all ears when our gathering devotes itself entirely to hearkening” > “we have heard (gehört) when we belong to (gehören) the matter addressed (Zugesprochenen)”: letting that which lies before lie gathered in its entirety [wholeness], selfsameness, omologein, the letting-lie establishes

HDG.IM.content: “we lie in the pincers” > people must transpose itself from center of future happening into originary realm of powers of Being [but you haven’t answered Nietzsche yet!!!] > to ask how does it stand w/ Being? to repeat and retrieve (wieder-holen) inception of our historical-spiritual Dasein (inception begun again more originally) [repetition of origin]
HDG.IM.linkedContent: “we lie in the pincers” > people must transpose itself from center of future happening into originary realm of powers of Being [but you haven’t answered Nietzsche yet!!!] > to ask how does it stand w/ Being? to repeat and retrieve (wieder-holen) inception of our historical-spiritual Dasein (inception begun again more originally) [repetition of origin]

HDG.IM.content: demonic [Kierkegaard?]: destroy all rank, all that is world-spiritual, portray these as a lie  > phenomenon of literati/aesthetes: spirit falsified as intelligence
HDG.IM.linkedContent: demonic [Kierkegaard?]: destroy all rank, all that is world-spiritual, portray these as a lie > phenomenon of literati/aesthetes: spirit falsified as intelligence

HDG.BC.content: “poetic propositions” : “poetic” is the exception, things don’t lie as much on surface as they do in familiar [would Derrida agree?] > “is” derives [schöpft?] its meaning from being represented/addressed/articulated in proposition [Being needs beings]

HDG.BC.content: [Nietzsche’s nearly Marxist take on a future where each human achieves the highest that lies w/in his realm] > “worker,” “soldier,” “socialist,” for Nietzsche, leading representatives enacting “will to power”
HDG.BC.linkedContent: [Nietzsche’s nearly Marxist take on a future where each human achieves the highest that lies w/in his realm] > “worker,” “soldier,” “socialist,” for Nietzsche, leading representatives enacting “will to power”

HDG.FS.content: the scission (Ent-zweiung) lies in movement (Bewegung) of Ent-, a departure (Aufbruch), something leaves something (weg-geht): 2 separate (trennen) into 2
HDG.FS.linkedContent: the scission (Ent-zweiung) lies in movement (Bewegung) of Ent-, a departure (Aufbruch), something leaves something (weg-geht): 2 separate (trennen) into 2

HDG.FS.content: [Heidegger going to clarify misunderstandings of Seinsfrage] > history of metaphysics has given many answers to Seinsfrage, e.g. Aristotle say energeia, not upokeimenon, latter an interpretation of beings not Being [upokeimenon as presencing (Anwesen) of island, the being as it lets itself be seen, island lies in sea]
HDG.FS.linkedContent: [Heidegger going to clarify misunderstandings of Seinsfrage] > history of metaphysics has given many answers to Seinsfrage, e.g. Aristotle say energeia, not upokeimenon, latter an interpretation of beings not Being [upokeimenon as presencing (Anwesen) of island, the being as it lets itself be seen, island lies in sea]

HDG.FS.content: in Greek manner, einai means to presence (Greeks speak more revealingly (zeigender)/precisely than we do) [Heidegger’s bias?] > Parmenides’ esti gar einai, genuine tautology: names Same only once, as itself: [fragment 8] “the same dwelling in the same, it lies in itself” [cf. 80 verse is eukuklos, abundant/overflowing, says on its own complete tautology] > in domain of inapparent (Unscheinbaren): presencing itself presences (anwest Anwesen selbst): “great number of indications (Zeignisse) [marks? traces?]…”, indication as sēma, what shows & lets be seen
HDG.FS.linkedContent: in Greek manner, einai means to presence (Greeks speak more revealingly (zeigender)/precisely than we do) [Heidegger’s bias?] > Parmenides’ esti gar einai, genuine tautology: names Same only once, as itself: [fragment 8] “the same dwelling in the same, it lies in itself” [cf. 80 verse is eukuklos, abundant/overflowing, says on its own complete tautology] > in domain of inapparent (Unscheinbaren): presencing itself presences (anwest Anwesen selbst): “great number of indications (Zeignisse) [marks? traces?]…”, indication as sēma, what shows & lets be seen

HDG.MA.content: only a ground for growth can lie fallow > expressway, where nothing grows, can’t be fallow [cf. Accursed Share, Bataille, restricted economy]

motif.name: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY
motif.title: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY

HDG.MA.linkedContent: only a ground for growth can lie fallow > expressway, where nothing grows, can’t be fallow [cf. Accursed Share, Bataille, restricted economy]

HDG.CCP.content: things appearing in Gegnet no longer objects, no longer stand opposite us, no longer stand at all > they lie, “rest in the return to the aiding of the expanse of their self-belonging” > there can be rest where rest is the seat/reign of all movement > we can’t really describe what he have named > non, any description would reify it > but, it lets itself be named & thus we can think about it (not representationally) > perhaps we are close to being released into nature of thinking…through waiting for its nature [arrival?]
HDG.CCP.linkedContent: things appearing in Gegnet no longer objects, no longer stand opposite us, no longer stand at all > they lie, “rest in the return to the aiding of the expanse of their self-belonging” > there can be rest where rest is the seat/reign of all movement > we can’t really describe what he have named > non, any description would reify it > but, it lets itself be named & thus we can think about it (not representationally) > perhaps we are close to being released into nature of thinking…through waiting for its nature [arrival?]

HDG.WL.content: if to know means to see something in wholeness of its nature, we can’t see the nature of language as such, in the round, because we belong w/in Saying, can only say something by saying it after Saying > language is monologue [cf. MONL], has its structure in the Aufriss of Saying: 1) language alone speaks authentically 2) language speaks lonesomely (einsam) > the some in lonesome, the same, Greek hama, Gothic sama, thus lonesome: “same in what unites that which belongs together” > Saying is in need of being voiced in word [Being needs man] > man’s needed usage (Brauchen), his resaying (Nachsagen) of what he listens to, lies in that lack (Fehlen) that isn’t negative or defective

motif.name: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE
motif.title: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE

MONL], has its structure in the Aufriss of Saying: 1) language alone speaks authentically 2) language speaks lonesomely (einsam) > the some in lonesome, the same, Greek hama, Gothic sama, thus lonesome: “same in what unites that which belongs together” > Saying is in need of being voiced in word [Being needs man] > man’s needed usage (Brauchen), his resaying (Nachsagen) of what he listens to, lies in that lack (Fehlen) that isn’t negative or defective

HDG.OHF.content: [existential analytic defines the how of Dasein’s being] [re: temporality of today?] Dasein has its open space of publicness (Öffentlichkeit) and its ways of Seeing (seine Sicht) [there] [cf. 38 summary of today] > moves in definite mode of discourse (Redens) about itself: Gerede (talk) preserves Dasein in averageness > in talk lies guiding “as what” by which Dasein addresses “itself” > talk as the how in which Dasein’s having-been-interpreted (Ausgelegtheit) stands at its disposal > not externally applied to Dasein, something from out of which it lives, is lived, a how of is being

motif.name: SACRIFICE [to define, philosophy of life required]
motif.title: SACRIFICE [to define, philosophy of life required]

HDG.OHF.linkedContent: [existential analytic defines the how of Dasein’s being] [re: temporality of today?] Dasein has its open space of publicness (Öffentlichkeit) and its ways of Seeing (seine Sicht) [there] [cf. 38 summary of today] > moves in definite mode of discourse (Redens) about itself: Gerede (talk) preserves Dasein in averageness > in talk lies guiding “as what” by which Dasein addresses “itself” > talk as the how in which Dasein’s having-been-interpreted (Ausgelegtheit) stands at its disposal > not externally applied to Dasein, something from out of which it lives, is lived, a how of is being

HDG.OHF.content: “tarrying among (Verweilen bei)” sustains possibility of actualizing a universal classifying that compares [historical] forms, in it lies relational guarantee that every past culture can be encountered objectively > a constant seeing this & that, can never halt [cf. 45 abode-less tarrying (das aufenthaltslose Verweilen) that holds itself/sojourns in (Aufhalten) what it returns to) > what’s encountered in this Verweilen as universal possibility of expression, divided into unities of style: beings in the How of their having-being, already there [for us to see] (i.e. past is available, is a past present, not our virtuality) > a pull (Zug) arises from the already there (schon da) in the past: world, life, publicness, what was going on [if destruction occurs by thinking Zug outside of Zug of historical consciousness, deconstruction occurs by noting that Zug of historical consciousness never occurs, i.e that everyday facticity has been overdetermined, we were never that close to it]

motif.name: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE
motif.title: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE

HDG.OHF.linkedContent: “tarrying among (Verweilen bei)” sustains possibility of actualizing a universal classifying that compares [historical] forms, in it lies relational guarantee that every past culture can be encountered objectively > a constant seeing this & that, can never halt [cf. 45 abode-less tarrying (das aufenthaltslose Verweilen) that holds itself/sojourns in (Aufhalten) what it returns to) > what’s encountered in this Verweilen as universal possibility of expression, divided into unities of style: beings in the How of their having-being, already there [for us to see] (i.e. past is available, is a past present, not our virtuality) > a pull (Zug) arises from the already there (schon da) in the past: world, life, publicness, what was going on [if destruction occurs by thinking Zug outside of Zug of historical consciousness, deconstruction occurs by noting that Zug of historical consciousness never occurs, i.e that everyday facticity has been overdetermined, we were never that close to it]

HDG.OHF.content: as-what & How of the world’s being-encountered (Begegnens) lie in significance (Bedeutsamkeit), significance not a category of things but the categorial dimension of being-there > being of world & human life both designated by term Dasein > on basis of factical spatiality we can define ontological meaning of being “in” the environs (Umhaften) of world > “being” that encounters world as Weltdasein, characterized by caring, fundamental mode of being, it “is” its world, the very world it has encountered [hermeneutic circle]

motif.name: SACRIFICE [to define, philosophy of life required]
motif.title: SACRIFICE [to define, philosophy of life required]

HDG.OHF.linkedContent: as-what & How of the world’s being-encountered (Begegnens) lie in significance (Bedeutsamkeit), significance not a category of things but the categorial dimension of being-there > being of world & human life both designated by term Dasein > on basis of factical spatiality we can define ontological meaning of being “in” the environs (Umhaften) of world > “being” that encounters world as Weltdasein, characterized by caring, fundamental mode of being, it “is” its world, the very world it has encountered [hermeneutic circle]

HDG.OHF.content: only on basis (Grunde) of familiarity (Vertrautheit) [everydayness] can the “strange (Fremdes)” come forth > this lack of familiarity belongs to world being encountered, a heightened (gesteigertes) “there,” its inconvenience lies right w/in inexplicit (unabgehobenen) self-evidence of the familiarity of the there of everyday world > lack of familiarity belongs to world’s being-encountered, that’s why disturbed familiarity [contingent “otherwise than one thought”] has sense of being there > strange is there in its unpredictability/incalculability (Unberechenbarkeit)
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: only on basis (Grunde) of familiarity (Vertrautheit) [everydayness] can the “strange (Fremdes)” come forth > this lack of familiarity belongs to world being encountered, a heightened (gesteigertes) “there,” its inconvenience lies right w/in inexplicit (unabgehobenen) self-evidence of the familiarity of the there of everyday world > lack of familiarity belongs to world’s being-encountered, that’s why disturbed familiarity [contingent “otherwise than one thought”] has sense of being there > strange is there in its unpredictability/incalculability (Unberechenbarkeit)
